results.brief_description: A dramatised documenatry emphasizing that planning for retirement can ensure that leisure is fully and usefully used.

results.title: A Time for Georgia
results.brief_description: Describes the pathology of a four-year-old autistic child. Characteristic behaviour of this syndrome is clearly presented, as well as the gains such a child can make in a therapeutic nursery. Filmed at a community-based, therapeutic nursery-kindergarten.

results.title: A Time for drunken horses = Zamani baraye masti asbha [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bahman Ghobadi Films and Bahman Ghobadi
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Bahman Ghobadi “A Time for drunken horses” is an Iranian film set amid the mountainous border of Iran and Iraq. Ayoub (Ayoub Ahmadi) is a twelve-year-old Kurdish boy who is burdened with the economic responsibility of providing for his family. He has four bothers and sisters, one of whom is severely disabled. To eek out a living in the harsh landscape where his family live, Ayoub joins his uncle in a dangerous trade - taking pack mules loaded with truck tyres across the Iranian border to Iraq. The work is fraught with perils as the road is treacherous, bandits roam the terrain and rough weather impedes the journey. Once at the border Ayoub and his uncle ply their meagre goods, along with numerous others, for a pittance. Ayoub’s brother Madi is in need of a life saving operation that is prohibitively expensive for the impoverished family. Ayoub works against all the hazards to raise the necessary money. “A Time for drunken horses” has the feel and look of a documentary, one that expresses poignantly the trials of a valiant and resourceful child and his destitute people. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: A Time for decision
results.brief_description: Dramatises the problem of the compulsive drinker and considers how his family can find help in attaining a normal life, even though the alcoholic may continue drinking. Shows how communities can have various resources to provide hope and guidance.

results.title: A Time for caring (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Sexual abuse often starts between the ages of 5 and 10 and may continue into the teenage years. This program stresses that teachers and classified staff at schools should be aware of what to look for and what to do in cases of suspected sexual abuse. Narrated by Sandra Baker.

results.title: A Ticket in tatts
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: This film stars George Wallace as a disaster-prone stablehand who owns a whistle that can make Cup favorite Hotspur run faster. A sub-plot of the film concerns a high society romance where a young girl has undertaken to marry an ageing suitor if his horse defeats Hotspur in the Cup. Much of the shooting for this film was taken away from the usual studio scene to location scenes at a stud farm near Melbourne, the Flemington racecourse and in the grounds of a palatial Melbourne villa.

results.title: A Thousand suns
results.brief_description: Shows how people in the United States have used energy capabilities to create luxuries never dreamed possible, but have also created a throw away society where little of value endures. Emphasises the importance of creating values that last, such as self-respect and respect for all other living things.
